answers.answer: You will need to take him to the vet for a complete work up, including CBC/Chem/T4, Lyme and other tick disease check, Heartworm check, urinalysis, and bloodwork for other endocrine disorders, fecal check for parasites, and any additional tests and procedures that your vet deems necessary.This is not something you should wait on.  Unexplained weight loss could be a sign of Addisons disease, diabetes and other endocrine disorders, severe parasite infestation, neoplasm, and many others possibilities.

question: i have a 3 year old american bulldog and as of recently he has been losing weight regardless of how much he is being fed. he has also pulled out alot of his hair on his back and tail. any idea on what would be wrong. he looks miserable and i dont know what to do for him.
title: losing hair and weight.
